recipes.label: In From the Cold
recipes.startdescription: The sun has set. The train of desperates that has followed me west for the past month grinds to a halt and sets down camp. Four of my comrades huddle with me around a small fire. We are silent together, until a visitor emerges from the night. My heart stops when I see them.
recipes.description: 'Scream, and you will all die tonight.'

recipes.label: Rules of the Game
recipes.startdescription: 'Behave and listen, now. Things are in motion, and so I come to test you: a game, to see who can draw whose blood. If I win, I get to have the life of one of your little friends. If you win, then I will go, and leave you in... peace.' The Exile seems to choke on the word as they push it past their lips.
recipes.description: 'Here - to make it a little fairer. You're welcome.' The Exile tosses something down into the dirt by my feet.

recipes.label: Saith the Wolf to the Lamb
My Opponent Strikes!
recipes.startdescription: The Exile darts forward. There is steel so suddenly in their hand, and its jagged edge is so suddenly near -
recipes.description: I cannot hear myself scream - perhaps the pain is so blinding-hot I have not yet regained the faculties to scream. The Exile wipes the blade. 'I'm afraid you lost.'

recipes.label: A Choice
recipes.startdescription: 'Rules are rules. Choose someone you'll miss the least,' the Exile smiles. 'Think about it for as long as you must.'

slots.label: A Choice
slots.description: Who will I condemn to death?

recipes.label: A Choice, Made
recipes.startdescription: 'Don't cry. I'm sure they didn't like you very much anyway.'
recipes.description: My poor companion's eyes are dull glass, and the earth drinks their blood. This is, notably, the quickest I've ever seen the Exile kill someone. 'You have a long way to go,' the Exile starts again, 'before you're ready for what's to come.'

recipes.label: The Coming Feast
recipes.startdescription: 'You're trying to escape all this, because you're weak and afraid. But there's something greater than your fear: hate. You hate those who starved you, worked you; you hate the world that allowed this to happen to you; you hate me. Don't you want us all to beg your forgiveness? For us to bleed and scream like you had to?'
recipes.description: 'Remember what I taught you: of the Hours of the Edge, the Wolf-Divided alone understands vengeance. As do his Names. There is a seat for a seventh among them - a last seat, before the feast begins. One with the proper hate might carve a path to that seat. You think on that.' The Exile draws back, a monster receding into shadow. 'We may meet again, before the end. I hope we do.'

recipes.label: Onwards
recipes.startdescription: The night passes in a blur of pain and grief. When I return to my senses, the sun has risen, my wound has been dressed, and my companion is still dead. I wince as I turn - the wound is not as dressed as I thought.
recipes.description: The others are numb to the sight of the corpse in the light of dawn. Silently, I am thankful I must not speak of it as I devise our path forward. It goes either to Berlin, or to escape. The wind howls. I think, for the briefest of moments, about the Exile's proposal.
